display_name: Spinal Tap (All weeks in one day)
scheme: Run 3 weeks of 5/3/1 %s in one session (no PR sets)
notes: Very high stress; TM increases each workout.

scheme: As above but all work sets are triples
notes: Best used on deadlift; purely triples across.

scheme: As SPINAL TAP days but allow PRs/Jokers at 90/95/85 as warranted
notes: Use bar speed to decide Jokers; don’t force PRs.
Used by multiple Anchor templates.

scheme: 5x5/3/1 as Leader; Anchor allows PR/Widowmaker options
conditioning_mode: Do easy conditioning on off‑days; advanced lifters only
notes: Perfect form; never more than 80% TM; not for beginners.
Follows Leader/Anchor model

scheme: Day 1 Squat 5/3/1+; Day 2 Bench 5/3/1+; Day 3 Press 5/3/1 + Deadlift 5/3/1
notes: Classic v2 update to the 2E full body; simple assistance.

display_name: Full Body — Full Boring (high DL freq)
notes: Beginners OK; advanced lifters limit DL stress.
PC primes the heavy work days; alternate PC/DL as needed.

scheme: Main lift PR on day; 65/75/85 non‑PR on others
notes: Squat appears on all days in certain setups.
Map weeks exactly: W1 50, W2 50, W3 60, W4 60, W5 70, W6 70.
6-week progression; do required reps on main, then 5x10 @ first-set percent.
Week-to-week set/rep change for BBB work.
Push last 5/3/1 set weekly but keep BBB prescription.
Start at 30–40% TM if new to BBB; deload options vary.
Template One only; very taxing.
Moderate variant—logical volume ramp.

scheme: 5/3/1 (PR on main sets per book guidance)
notes: Spans 27 weeks if you chain 5x5→5x3→5x1; see book mapping.

scheme: 5/3/1 (PR on main sets in prior block)
notes: Often follows BBB 5x10 block.
Typically run after 5x5 variation.
Also includes 3/5/1 order option.
27‑week longform progression end‑cap.
“Increase TM after week 3” rule.
“Choose deload that matches fatigue & goals.”

assistance_mode: Scale assistance down when conditioning up
notes: Volume must reflect conditioning load
Pieces of BBS + Spinal Tap; longer full cycle; patience required.

scheme: Work to TM PR set then Jokers (105–120%)
notes: Auto‑regulated heavy singles with structured down sets.
Use PR set then Jokers when strong; balance with FSL volume.
Week 3 keep working up for 3–5 singles; attempt max if good.
Clear deload and conditioning rules included.
Hit total 10 reps across as many sets as needed

leader_anchor_fit: Bar speed must stay crisp; 85–90% TM.
notes: 5/3/1 Forever
PR sets limited; per‑lift supplemental volume is the lever.

scheme: Work to TM single every week in Leader and Anchor
notes: Singles, doubles or triples leading to TM; then supplemental selection.

scheme: Work‑set ladder (e.g., 70/80/90; 75/85/95; 65/75/85 — all x5, no PRs)
assistance_mode: Superset bodyweight + single‑leg + rows per day (see notes)
notes: Exact 9 work sets ladder; pair assistance each set. No extra reps on work sets.

display_name: Winter Strength & Conditioning — 8 Week Cycle (Weight Room)
notes: Extra 3x5 at 55/65/75% are submax; chins between sets; start too light. (p.132–135)
Falling-start sprints; Box Jumps at 80% of max; Week 4 deload; full recovery between reps.
Push-up start accelerations; introduce Kneeling Coil Throw; Week 4 deload.
15–20 min football skills; increased sprint distances; Box-from-Box, Depth Jumps; deload in Weeks 4 and 9.
Linemen emphasis on Coil Throws; deload Weeks 4 and 9; same 3-day field structure.

display_name: Going Into the Summer — 9 Week Training Cycle (Weight Room)
notes: Lower weight-room volume; more speed; deload Week 6 (use deload %); typical assistance listed per day.
Adds 30–40 yd runs, Hurdles, Double Broad Throw; Week 4 deload.
Linemen keep Coil Throws focus; Week 4 deload; same 3-day structure.

display_name: Summer Pre-Camp — 6 Week Training Cycle (Weight Room)
notes: Simple, repeatable Mon/Wed/Fri lift order; Week 4 deload (use deload %); assistance kept efficient.
